descriptions: Student is not involved in any clubs, organizations, or activities related to health in the school or community.
Student shows minimal awareness of available opportunities for involvement.
Student occasionally attends meetings or events but does not actively participate.
Student is a member of at least one club, organization, or activity and attends regularly.
Student actively participates in at least one club, organization, or activity, contributing ideas and efforts.
Student takes a leadership role in a health-related club, organization, or activity, demonstrating commitment and initiative.
Participation has no noticeable impact on student's personal health or the health of others.
Student reports minimal personal benefit from participation.
Student identifies some positive impacts on their own health and well-being.
Student contributes positively to the group and encourages participation from others.
Student demonstrates a clear understanding of how their involvement positively impacts both their own health and the health of others.
Student leads initiatives that promote health and well-being within the school or community, creating a positive impact on a larger scale.
Student demonstrates no understanding of health-related issues discussed or addressed in activities.
Student shows limited understanding of health-related issues.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of health-related issues discussed or addressed in activities.
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of health-related issues discussed or addressed in activities and can articulate them effectively.
Student applies their understanding of health-related issues to real-world situations and actively seeks to educate others.
Student analyzes complex health-related issues, develops innovative solutions, and advocates for positive change within the school or community.
